version_description:
Introducing Seesaw Blogs -- the easiest way to create a blog for your class! 
- Now you can create a public webpage for your class and give students a global audience for their work.
- Teachers and students can post a selection of Seesaw items to the class blog in just one tap. No other apps, websites or embed codes needed! All posts are teacher-moderated.
- Connect to other class blogs directly within the Seesaw app so students can easily comment and collaborate with students from other classrooms. 

Other Teacher-Requested Improvements
- Improvements to the approval queue: Filter by folders, better layout for new comments
- No more "hold still" when taking photos as a teacher
- More profile icons  
- Increase audio comment limit to 2 minutes
- Bug fixes for drawing + voice videos

Thanks for your feedback! Keep it coming!

3.0.1
- Improved camera rotation for taking photos and recording videos. No more upside-down videos!

3.0
Introducing Seesaw Blogs -- the easiest way to create a blog for your class! 
- Now you can create a public webpage for your class and give students a global audience for their work.
- Teachers and students can post a selection of Seesaw items to the class blog in just one tap. No other apps, websites or embed codes needed! All posts are teacher-moderated.
- Connect to other class blogs directly within the Seesaw app so students can easily comment and collaborate with students from other classrooms.

- AutoCrop: Camera now detects when you are taking a photo of a piece of paper and crops it automatically for you! 
- Seesaw Item QR Code Scanner: Using the Seesaw website, you can now generate a PDF of any Seesaw item with a unique QR code that links to that item. Scan with the Seesaw app to view, watch or listen! Find this tool in the Gear Menu. 
- When teachers post an "Everyone" item or don't tag an item with any students, it will show as posted by the teacher. Handy for newsletters or posting assignments.

Bug fixes: 
- Fixes bug where some students/teachers were being signed out of their account when exiting the app
- Blog header image and Note item types will now properly resize on iPhone and iPad

Bug fixes: 
-Fixes a bug where the "Published to Blog" banner indicator was hidden in the Feed View.

Seesaw 4.0 is here—chock full of enhancements and new teacher requested features!  
∙ Notifications Center - See a chronological log of all the activity in your class, including new items, comments, likes and more. Plus, fewer push notifications and emails!
∙ Notifications for Students - Students using email sign in or Class Code 1:1 sign in will also see the Notification Center, making it easier to see new feedback on their work. 

Introducing Seesaw Plus - a new paid offering with advanced tools for informal assessment, including:
∙ Skills View - Teachers already using Seesaw for formative assessments can now tag student posts with their own set of skills or standards. Optionally, assign a star rating to get a real-time understanding of how students are progressing. 
∙ Private Notes - Teachers can take private notes on work that are visible only to teachers. Type a text note or record a voice note for yourself or to share with co-teachers.
∙ Private Items - Teachers can add student work into a private folder. Private posts are not visible to students or parents.

If you’re already using Seesaw for Schools, Seesaw Plus features are automatically enabled on your account.

Thank you again for your support and feedback! Let us know what you think by tweeting @Seesaw.

4.0.1 - Fix for bug that was causing the app to crash for some users using iOS 8.

4.0 - Seesaw 4.0 is here—chock full of enhancements and new teacher requested features!  
∙ Notifications Center - See a chronological log of all the activity in your class, including new items, comments, likes and more. Plus, fewer push notifications and emails!
∙ Notifications for Students - Students using email sign in or Class Code 1:1 sign in will also see the Notification Center, making it easier to see new feedback on their work.

∙ Skills View - Teachers already using Seesaw for formative assessments can now tag student posts with their own set of skills or standards. Optionally, assign a star rating to get a real-time understanding of how students are progressing. 
∙ Private Notes - Teachers can take private notes on work that are visible only to teachers. Type a text note or record a voice note for yourself or to share with co-teachers.
∙ Private Items - Teachers can add student work into a private folder. Private posts are not visible to students or parents.

If you’re already using Seesaw for Schools, Seesaw Plus features are automatically enabled on your account.

Thank you again for your support and feedback! Let us know what you think by tweeting @Seesaw.

4.02 - Fix for a bug that was causing the folders a student selected while adding a new item to not stay tagged on the item. 
4.01 - Fix for a bug that was causing the app to crash for some users on iOS 8.

4.0 - Seesaw 4.0 is here—chock full of enhancements and new teacher requested features!  
∙ Notifications Center - See a chronological log of all the activity in your class, including new items, comments, likes and more. Plus, fewer push notifications and emails!
∙ Notifications for Students - Students using email sign in or Class Code 1:1 sign in will also see the Notification Center, making it easier to see new feedback on their work. 

Introducing Seesaw Plus - a new paid offering with advanced tools for informal assessment, including:
∙ Skills View - Teachers already using Seesaw for formative assessments can now tag student posts with their own set of skills or standards. Optionally, assign a star rating to get a real-time understanding of how students are progressing. 
∙ Private Notes - Teachers can take private notes on work that are visible only to teachers. Type a text note or record a voice note for yourself or to share with co-teachers.
∙ Private Items - Teachers can add student work into a private folder. Private posts are not visible to students or parents.

If you’re already using Seesaw for Schools, Seesaw Plus features are automatically enabled on your account.

Thank you again for your support and feedback! Let us know what you think by tweeting @Seesaw.

4.03
∙ Built-in QR reader for all Seesaw post QR codes you print out! Visible to teachers and all students. Tap on your profile icon, then tap the QR code icon in the header bar. 
∙ Switch your student sign in mode from Class Code sign in to Email Sign in mode, and vice versa. 
∙ Added a tool to combine student journals within the same class if needed after switching student sign in mode.
∙ See the number of posts in each student journal or folder as a teacher. 
∙ Improvements to Notifications Center (Thank you for your feedback! Please keep it coming).   
∙ Other fixes: Improved +New Class flow, shake device to contact Seesaw support for teachers, reset to 'initials' profile icon. 

4.0 - Seesaw 4.0 is here—chock full of enhancements and new teacher requested features!  
∙ Notifications Center - See a chronological log of all the activity in your class, including new items, comments, likes and more. Plus, fewer push notifications and emails!
∙ Notifications for Students - Students using email sign in or Class Code 1:1 sign in will also see the Notification Center, making it easier to see new feedback on their work. 

Introducing Seesaw Plus - a new paid offering with advanced tools for informal assessment, including:
∙ Skills View - Teachers already using Seesaw for formative assessments can now tag student posts with their own set of skills or standards. Optionally, assign a star rating to get a real-time understanding of how students are progressing. 
∙ Private Notes - Teachers can take private notes on work that are visible only to teachers. Type a text note or record a voice note for yourself or to share with co-teachers.
∙ Private Items - Teachers can add student work into a private folder. Private posts are not visible to students or parents.

Thank you again for your support and feedback! Let us know what you think by tweeting @Seesaw.

4.04
∙ Support for Clever sign on for teachers and students (requires Seesaw for Schools account). 

4.03
∙ Built-in QR reader for all Seesaw post QR codes. Tap on your profile icon, then tap the QR code icon to scan! Works for teachers and students! 
∙ See the number of posts in each student journal or folder as a teacher. 
∙ Switch student sign in mode from Class Code sign in to Email Sign in mode, and vice versa. 
∙ Tool to combine student journals within the same class after switching student sign in mode.
∙ Other fixes: Improved +New Class flow, shake device to contact Seesaw support for teachers, reset to blue 'initials' profile icon, Improvements to Notifications Center

Add Text Labels to Any Photo, Drawing or Drawing Video! 
∙ Annotate any photo or drawing with customizable text labels.   
∙ Choose from 8 preset styles. Or completely customize font, color, background and borders. 
∙ Create videos with text labels, drawing and voice -- making this tool an even more powerful way to explain and reflect!

Translate into 50+ Languages for Families & Teachers 
∙ If a note, caption or comment is written in a language that is different from the language of a parent or teacher’s device, a “See Translation” option appears below the post. Tap that button to automatically translate into your native language. 
∙ Supports 50+ languages, including Spanish, French, Italian, German, Somali, Chinese, and more! Translation is available on all platforms.  
∙ Making Seesaw more accessible to the families in your community is extremely important to us. We hope this feature helps everyone communicate more easily.  

Seesaw Blogs Improvements
∙ New “Followers” tab so you can see who is connected to your Seesaw blog, and connect back with them.  
∙ Easier ways to customize your image, and manage your blog settings and appearance

- Add up to 5 minutes of voice annotation to PDFs! Just hit [...] then Edit Item to add voice. 
- New text label drawing styles, including transparent background style perfect for emojis! 
- Fixes several bugs, including bug where photos/videos/drawings were not saving automatically to Camera Roll and bug where Category field was not displayed for Skills. 
- Uses updated Google Sign in code.

Bug Fixes
∙  Fixes crash when leaving a like or comment in the approval queue 
∙  Fixes several iOS 8 crashes

- Clickable links! URLs in any approved comments or notes are now clickable and will open an in-app webpage, making it easier to share a link in the comments or link to to multiple resources in one Note post.
- Bug fixes and performance improvements.

- Bug fixes and performance improvements. 
- Enhancements for force touch-compatible devices (iPhone 6S, iPhone 7): Leave an emoji quick-comment by long pressing on the Comment icon. Choose from happy face, star, heart, clapping and more! From the home screen, long press on the app icon and get a shortcut to the photo, video, drawing and camera roll tools to create a new Seesaw post!

- Class Code Classes: The text class code now lasts for 1 hour, so students can use the same sign in code for a whole class period. 
- Email Classes: The Join Code that students use to connect their email address to your class now lasts for 7 days, making it much easier to connect students to your class!
- Show / hide password option so you can see what password you are entering when signing in or creating your account. 

Thank you for your feedback and suggestions!

- Google Drive, Dropbox and iCloud Integration is here! Tap the *new* Add File button, then select files from Google Drive, iCloud Drive or Dropbox to add into Seesaw. Files are automatically converted into a Seesaw-compatible format like a PDF, making files easily viewable by students and connected families. 
- Teachers can now reset student passwords. If students forget the password to their Seesaw email account, teachers can set a new password for them from Manage Class > Manage Students menu. 
- Translation tool bug fixes. Fixes issue where "See Translation" was not showing consistently for devices set to languages other than English. 
- Other minor bug fixes and improvements.

Seesaw 5 is here! This is our biggest update since we launched Seesaw two years ago. Thank you for your feedback and support!
∙ Introducing Messages: Quickly send an announcement to all families or students in your class, or privately message individual parents right within Seesaw. 
∙ Simplified App Design: Journals, Blog, Skills, Inbox and class settings are all on one screen.
∙ Customizable Class Theme and Icon: Personalize your class with a fun color theme and snazzy icon. 
∙ Have families download our new Family app: Parents and families now have just one place to check to see recent posts, can browse portfolios using folders and calendar, and privately message teachers.

- Translation for messages! If a message is written in a language that is different from the language of a family member or teacher’s device, “See Translation” appears. Tap “See Translation” and Seesaw automatically translates the message into your native language. 
- Simplified new class creation process. 
- Notifications improvements for teachers. 
- Other bug fixes and improvements!

5.0.2
- Bug fixes 

5.0.1
- Translation for messages! If a message is written in a language that is different from the language of a family member or teacher’s device, “See Translation” appears. Tap “See Translation” and Seesaw automatically translates the message into your native language. 
- Simplified new class creation process. 
- Notifications improvements for teachers.

5.0.3
- Fixes bug where the +Join Class button did not show up in the left menu for email sign in students. 

5.0.1
- Translation for messages! If a message is written in a language that is different from the language of a family member or teacher’s device, “See Translation” appears. Tap “See Translation” and Seesaw automatically translates the message into your native language. 
- Simplified new class creation process. 
- Notifications improvements for teachers.

Introducing Albums—multiple photos is finally here! 
- Tap on Camera Roll, tap + Add More, select up to 10 photos for each album post. 
- Add one voice recording or caption to your album to add additional context or reflection.
Multiple photos is here!! 
Tap on Camera Roll, tap + Add More, select up to 10 photos for each album post. 
Add one voice recording or caption to your album to add additional context or reflection.
Perfect for documenting science experiments, recording writing assignments, sharing a field trip. 
Plus a other improvements:
It’s now easier to connect email sign in students to your class. Seesaw generates an invite email for your class, you can then send it to the right students. 
Design tweaks and enhancements to make Seesaw easier to use. 

Plus other improvements:
- It's now easier to connect students to your email sign in class. Seesaw will generate an invite email that you can send to your students. 
- Design tweaks and enhancements to make Seesaw easier to use.

- Getting Started Checklist for teachers built right into the app! Follow this 6 step guide and you’ll be rockin’ with Seesaw in your classroom. 
- 10 Minute Videos! Students can now record up to 10 minutes of video or drawing + voice video. 
- No more comic sans in 4th-12th grade. We heard you, and now the Note tool for 4th-12th grade classes uses a more mature sans serif font. ;)  
- Save full albums to your camera roll from the [...] menu. 
- Plus bug fixes: the Connected Blogs button is back for students; fixes student names getting cut off on iPhone; fixes Skills View not updating after upgrading to Seesaw Plus on iPhone.

- Fixes bug where photo album posts would sometimes be missing a photo
- Fixes app crash when class name was deleted in Class Settings
- Fixes app crash when the last family member was removed from a student

Bug Fixes: 
- Fixes bug where long messages got cut off on iOS 9 devices
- Fixes bug where teachers couldn't sign in if they had zero classes
- Fixes bug where the button controls on the Add File tool were white text on white background (iPhone only)

Introducing Activities! Easily create and share activities for your students to complete in Seesaw. 
- Activity Library: Get inspired with grade-level specific activities from our library that are ready to use right away, or create your own! 
- Simplify Classroom Workflow: Share activities with your whole class or with specific students to differentiate instruction. Students complete activities with any Seesaw tool, and all student responses are organized on one screen. Plus, families don't get notified about activities until their child's response is approved. 
- Save Time: Easily copy activities between your classes or use them again next school year. Add folders or skills to activities to keep student portfolios better organized. 

More Updates: 
- Teachers can now edit or delete a message they've sent! Just tap the [...] button on any message or announcement you wrote. (Thank you all for your feedback about this feature; we'll be making messaging better and better this year!)
- Teachers can pick their school in the app to make it easier to connect with other teachers using Seesaw.

Introducing Activities! Easily create and share activities for your students to complete in Seesaw. 
- Activity Library: Get inspired with grade-level specific activities from our library that are ready to use right away, or create your own! 
- Simplify Classroom Workflow: Share activities with your whole class or with specific students to differentiate instruction. Students complete activities with any Seesaw tool, and all student responses are organized on one screen. Plus, families don't get notified about activities until their child's response is approved. 
- Save Time: Easily copy activities between your classes or use them again next school year. Add folders or skills to activities to keep student portfolios better organized. 

More Updates: 
- Teachers can now edit or delete a message they've sent! Just tap the [...] button on any message or announcement you wrote. (Thank you all for your feedback about this feature; we'll be making messaging better and better this year!)
- Teachers can pick their school in the app to make it easier to connect with other teachers using Seesaw.

In 5.5.1
- Small bug fixes for Activities

- Share activities with other teachers! Customize or create a new activity, then share it with teacher friends, who can use the activity in their own classes. Choose “Get Activity Link” from the [...] menu, then share via social or email. Don’t worry, no student responses are shared.    
- Scheduled Activities: With Seesaw Plus or Seesaw for Schools, you can now schedule activities for dates and times in the future. 
- New shortcuts for added for activity instructions: Pointer arrow :arrow:, big green + :plus:, pause :pause:, and camera roll :cameraroll:. 

Other improvements: 
- We now indicate if an activity example or template is a video, PDF, link or album. 
- Uploading the same type of post back-to-back in shared device classes with students can see each other's work OFF is now fixed.

Happy New Year! In this release, Seesaw now supports iPhone X! We’ve also fixed a few bugs, including: 
∙ Fixes issue where iOS 11 screencast videos would not play back when recorded in landscape mode. 
∙ Fixes issue where email/push settings would not change in Account Settings. 
∙ Fixes crash on the Inbox tab when loading some messages.

5.6.2
∙ Fixes crash when liking or commenting on the last post in the feed

5.6.1
Seesaw now supports iPhone X! 
We’ve also fixed a few bugs, including: 
∙ Fixes issue where iOS 11 screencast videos would not play back when recorded in landscape mode. 
∙ Fixes issue where email/push settings would not change in Account Settings. 
∙ Fixes crash on the Inbox tab when loading some messages.

∙ Google Drive integration is fixed! Tap the “Add File” tool to add files from Google Drive right into Seesaw. If the file is a Doc, Slides, Sheets or Drawing, it will be automatically converted into a PDF. If it is already an image, video or PDF file, we’ll just add it directly to Seesaw. 
∙ Fixes crash when uploading a banner image to the blog.

Seesaw messaging is now better than ever! 
- Add photos, videos, PDFs, links and more to the announcements and private messages you send in Seesaw. 
- Families can also message you back with Seesaw’s built-in creative tools, keeping your parent communication in one place.  
- We hope this new feature makes teacher-family communication in Seesaw more useful, expressive and fun!  
- Multimedia messaging was one of our top feature requests. Thank you for helping us make Seesaw better every month.
Bug fixes
Fix a crash when using Activities on iOS 9.

∙ Seesaw has implemented the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) going into effect in the EU and UK. Learn more at web.seesaw.me/privacy. 
∙ Fixes bug where sometimes photos and videos would not save to the camera roll on iOS 11.
Bug fixes

Get ideas and save prep time with the newly expanded Activity Library! 
∙ Discover tons of activities created by Seesaw Ambassadors that are ready to use with your students. 
∙ Quickly find an activity by grade level or subject area to share right in Seesaw, customizing it if you like. 
∙ Share any activity with multiple classes at once. 
∙ If you’re using Seesaw Plus or Seesaw for Schools, you can organize your activities into collections and schedule activities to be shared at a specific time.

Activities is now even better with 100s of new activities added to the Library each week! 
- Tag a folder when sharing an activity and all student responses are organized into that folder. 
- Differentiate your instruction by selecting which students to receive an activity. Works best in Email and Class Code-1:1 Devices sign in modes. Change your sign in mode in Class Settings.  
- See all of the archived activities for your class in the Archived section of the Activities tab. 
- Students can view and listen to instructions while responding to activities by tapping the View Instructions banner at the top of the page. 
Plus lots of other bug fixes and small improvements. Thanks for all of the feedback!

∙ Browse over 3,000 new ideas for how to use Seesaw with your students in the Activity Library! Check out the Getting Started Collection if you’re brand new to Seesaw, or explore our community’s favorite ‘Get to Know Me’ activities for Back to School. 
∙ Improvements to searching and browsing the Activity Library. 
∙ Bug fixes and performance improvements.

∙ Looking for a lesson idea for tomorrow? Browse the Seesaw Activity Library. Hundreds of new activity ideas are added each week, ready for you to use with students or customize. 
∙ Easily save activities you find on social media or shared by a colleague via email. Tap the Save Activity button and the activity will be saved to My Library. 
∙ Support for student sign in using Clever Badges for Seesaw for Schools customers.
- Fixes bug where teachers couldn't print the QR code poster for their class.

- Looking for an idea for tomorrow? Browse new activities added to the Library for Fall! Check out trending searches or browse the profile of inspiring teachers in our community. 
- Activities improvements: Make it easier to share activities to your classes, copy voice instructions when copy & editing an activity, find similar teacher-contributed activities while browsing the library. 
- Upgraded video player
- Allow Swift Playground app to share via Share extension into Seesaw 
- Fix bug deleting attachments when sending an announcement 
- Fix bug where sometimes it was not possible to turn ON push notifications.

- Explore Seesaw’s tools before there are students in a new class using the Sample Student! Want to add Sample Student to your existing class to make it easier to demo Seesaw to students? Tap the wrench icon to open Class Settings, then turn Enable Sample Student to ON. 
- Joining a class and signing in as a student using an email address or Google account is now even easier—fewer taps is always better!  
- It’s also easier to add students to your class and get them signed in to Seesaw. Tap +Students for instructions.  
- Choose a fun class icon to represent your class. Tap on the wrench icon and pick a cute icon or upload one of your own. Whenever you tag all students in your class, your class icon will show.

- Celebrate the end of the year with Seesaw. Browse hundreds of new activities that encourage students to reflect on the season, traditions, celebrations, and their goals!
- Upload videos from Google Drive
- Improved Google sign on

Check out the improvements to Skills! It's now more flexible, customizable, and easier to apply in your classroom.

Look for:
- More star rating options for a wider range of scales and assessment styles
- Smoother flow!
    - Tag skills on both student posts and activities
    - Assign star ratings right as you approve student posts

We’ve made a couple of additional improvements to Skills:
- It’s now easier to get started using Skills for the first time
- Assign star ratings right as you approve student posts and activities
Bug fixes

Explore new creative tools that make Seesaw even better for empowering students! We’ve added tools and enhanced existing ones to unlock more opportunities for students to think creatively and reflect. We can’t wait to see how your students Create. Reflect. Seesaw!

∙ Bigger canvas, endless possibilities: Students tap the drawing tool to explore a new full screen, open-ended canvas, with more space and more choice to demonstrate their learning.
∙ New intuitive tools for all learners: Expressive new pens, shapes, backgrounds, undo/redo buttons and video improvements give students more options to show what they know.
∙ More opportunities for deeper learning: With the new collage feature, students can add multiple photos to any piece of work - a top teacher feature request!

Explore new creative tools! See how expressive pens, shapes, backgrounds, undo/redo, collage and Draw+Record features unlock more opportunities for students to think creatively and reflect. This update includes bug fixes for those new tools.

This update includes bug fixes and performance improvements to the new creative tools, including... 
- Support for zooming in on posts. Just tap on a post to expand it, then pinch to zoom. 
- Fix for "Cannot Upload Post" error that some students saw when responding to an activity.  
- Fix for issue where tools would stop working after a lot of drawing and erasing or adding many photos. 
- Fix for bug where adding text labels was broken if using a split screen keyboard. 
Keep the feedback coming! We appreciate your help making sure Seesaw works great for students!

This update includes bug fixes and performance improvements to the new creative tools, including... 
- Making it easier to select colors for the drawing tools 
- Retry uploading posts if the first upload is unsuccessful 
- Fix app crash when adding a label if you shake to undo 
- Higher-quality images in the Journal
Keep the feedback coming! We appreciate your help making sure Seesaw works great for students!

Fixes bug where some photos and photo albums appeared extra small in the Journal feed view.
Stay tuned for more exciting updates for Back to School!

Lots of great improvements to the new creative tools including lock, rotate and music backgrounds. 
- Lock tool to freeze background images or other elements in place so it’s easier for students to do activities and only move the right stuff 
- Photo upload the wrong way? Now there’s a rotate option for photos in albums 
- Music staff background and bass and treble clef shapes 
Keep the feedback coming!
More improvements to the creative tools, including additional font and styling options for labels. Keep the feedback coming!

Introducing Multipage, our top teacher feature request, just in time for back to school!
- Students can create posts of up to 10 pages and use Seesaw’s powerful creative tools, like voice and collage, on every page.
- Teachers can create Multipage posts, activity examples, activity templates and announcements. 
- Multipage is a premium feature. If you don’t have access to premium features, try them free for 60 days!

Introducing Multipage, just in time for back to school!
- Create posts of up to 10 pages and use Seesaw’s powerful creative tools, like voice and collage, on every page.
- Multipage is a premium feature. If you don’t have access to premium features, try them free for 60 days!

This update includes several multipage bug fixes. Keep the feedback coming!

Introducing Multipage, just in time for back to school!
- Create posts of up to 10 pages and use Seesaw’s powerful creative tools, like voice and collage, on every page.
- Multipage is a premium feature. If you don’t have access to premium features, try them free for 60 days!
This update includes several multipage bug fixes. Keep the feedback coming!

Introducing Multipage, just in time for back to school!
- Create posts of up to 10 pages and use Seesaw’s powerful creative tools, like voice and collage, on every page.
- Multipage is a premium feature. If you don’t have access to premium features, try them free for 60 days!
This update includes several bug fixes for the creative tools. Keep the feedback coming!
Bug fixes for the creative tools. Thank you for all of the feedback and helping make sure Seesaw works great for your students!

Visual updates to the Journal and Activity feed.
Bug fixes for the creative tools. 

Thank you for all of the feedback and helping make sure Seesaw works great for your students!

- Make it easier to grab and move small labels and shapes.  
- Resize buttons and drawing pens on smaller screens so less of your content is overlapped by tools. 
- Fix issue where the app would freeze when taking a photo if too many apps were running in the background. 
- If it’s taking a long time to upload a post, now we’ll let you know why instead of just showing a spinner. 
- Have the Pages menu closed by default for students when creating a new post they have the maximum amount canvas space to work with.
Bug fixes and improvements for the creative tools
Improvements and bug fixes for the creation tools that students use to document their learning.

Introducing drafts—no more losing work or rushing to finish at the end of class. Students can now save work in progress and finish it later. Drafts are part of our premium creative tools, and teachers can start a free 60 day trial. This update also includes additional enhancements to Seesaw's creation tools. Keep the feedback coming!
Bug fixes and improvements to Seesaw's creation tools. Thank you for all of your feedback -- keep it coming!

New! When you upload Google Docs, Slides, Sheets or PDFs into your portfolio, you can now use all of Seesaw’s creative tools, like drawing, voice recording and labels, to add an insightful layer of context on top. Plus, zoom in on specific areas of your page and more easily create detailed posts.
- Additionally, teachers creating activities can now attach activity examples and templates that were created with other apps or file formats, including PDFs, Docs and Slides.
- Free users have access to Seesaw’s creation tool on any one-page document. Premium users have access to Seesaw’s creation tools on any 10-page document.

When you a Google Doc, Slide, Sheet or PDF into Seesaw, you can now use all of Seesaw’s creative tools to add an insightful layer of context on top—now supporting up to 20 pages! Get access to the full document by tapping “View Original” in the Journal, messaging or expanded post view.  Happy holidays and thank you for everything you do to support your students on their learning journey!

Create powerful feedback loops between teacher and student with Send Back Draft, Seesaw’s newest premium feature. Teachers can comment on work in progress and students can review and improve their work before it's shared with classmates and families. 
- Drafts allow student work to be saved, revised, and revisited at any time.
- Drafts and Send Back are part of our premium product. Teachers can start a free 60 day trial anytime!
Improvements to Seesaw's creation tools and iOS 13 compatibility.
Fix bug with adding PDF files using the Share Extension on iOS 13.

This update makes it easier for students to sign in from home using a Home Learning sign in code when emergencies prevent them from coming to school. Please visit https://web.seesaw.me/home-learning to learn how to set up Seesaw for home learning.

Improvements for remote learning, including opening links in lessons shared by teachers in Safari and making it easier for students to sign out of their Home Learning account when families with multiple children are sharing one device.

- More background colors in the creation tools! 
- Fix for tiny images when adding photos on to your 2nd-20th page 
- Fix bug viewing posts created by other students on the blog tab 
- Fixes for top crashes

- Improvements to Seesaw’s creation tools for creating and responding to activities. 
- Bug fixes
- Bug fixes

∙ Improvements to activities for teachers and students including: link to a specific activity, filter activity by folder to see just activities for a specific subject area and printing activities.  
∙ Bug fixes in the creative tools.

∙ Bug fixes for activities and messages
∙ Improvements to activities for teachers and students including: link to a specific activity, filter activity by folder to see just activities for a specific subject area, printing activities.

∙ View activities on a calendar on the day the activity was assigned.
∙ Teachers can pin one activity to the top of the Activities feed. Students see it at the top. 
∙ Teachers can pin one post to the top of the Journal feed. Students see it at the top.  
∙ Improvements to recovering work in progress if the app crashes or you quit the app.

∙ Bug fixes for post recovery and creative tools

New in 7.5: 
∙ View activities on a calendar on the day the activity was assigned.
∙ Teachers can pin one activity to the top of the Activities feed. Students see it at the top. 
∙ Teachers can pin one post to the top of the Journal feed. Students see it at the top.  
∙ Improvements to recovering work in progress if the app crashes or you quit the app.
